p:
Chl fluorescence parameters of S. trilobata and S. calendulacea were measured using a Chl fluorescence imaging system (CF Imager, Technological Ltd. Colchester, UK). Five 8 mm leaf discs were placed in 12-well plates (each hole was filled with water). The leaf discs were adapted to the dark for 20 min before measurement. The determination procedure was set as follows: the saturated light pulse was 6162 mol m −2 s −1 (pulse time 1 s), the F m was induced, and the photochemical light intensity was 800 mol m −2 s −1. The photosynthetic electron transfer efficiency (ETR), actual photochemical efficiency (Φ PSII) and non-photochemical quenching (NPQ) were measured as described by Li et al.
